text: caramelized fish sauce and scotch rice
is such a great match making heaven
today i will share with you how to make
the vegan version of it let's
[Music]
begin scotch rice is a thin crust of
slightly brown rice at the bottom of the
cooking pot you can make it by spreading
cooked rice in a non-stick pan use a
rice later to press down to form a
really thin layer of rice at the base of
the pan constantly press down over
medium low heat occasionally dip the
rice later into a bowl of water to
prevent sticking keep doing this for
about 10 minutes until the rice form a
nice golden crust then you have scotch
rice without having to cook a whole pot
of rice cut into triangle pieces
to make the caramelized fish sauce or
cauliway cut 50 grams of king oyster
mushrooms and 50 grams of straw
mushrooms into small dices
thinly slice some leek
[Music]
add 2 tbsp of vegetable oil in a clay
pot and fry the slight leek until
fragrant then transfer the fried leek
into a bowl keeping the oil in the clay
pot add a teaspoon of brown sugar cook
over low heat until the sugar melts and
turn caramelized add the diced mushroom
stir well and add half a cup of water
half a teaspoon of salt 2 teaspoon soy
sauce and a teaspoon of sugar then mix a
teaspoon of corns or tapioca starch in
water and pour in slowly to thicken the
sauce add some cracked peppercorns and
then you have vegan cauli serve as a dip
for vegetables and scotch rice you can
add the remaining fried leek on top of
the scotch rice as a garnish mmm soda
classic i hope you like the recipe and
give it a try don't forget to subscribe
to my channel for more great vietnamese
recipes and vegan recipes like this i
will see you there next time bye
[Music]
